doc.title: ISP

value.content: An ISP (Internet Service Provider) sells Internet access, and sometimes email, web hosting, and voice over IP, either by a dial-up connection over a phone line (formerly more common), or through a broadband connection such as a cable modem or DSL service.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• How the Internet works (explanation for beginners)
  • Internet service provider on Wikipedia
